questions.question: What does the term evolution mean?
Who gave the first systematic explanation of evolution?
Animals without a backbone are called
Animals with a backbone are called
Which animals live both on land and in water?
Which of the following is a reptile?
Which group of animals is most evolved?
Which scientist classified animals before Darwin?
Which animals mostly lived on trees?
Which species could adapt survived in evolution?
What does the term evolution mean?
Who gave the first systematic explanation of evolution?

What does the term evolution mean?
Who gave the first systematic explanation of evolution?
Animals without a backbone are called
Animals with a backbone are called
Which animals live both on land and in water?
Which of the following is a reptile?
Which group of animals is most evolved?
Which scientist classified animals before Darwin?
Which animals mostly lived on trees?
Which species could adapt survived in evolution?
What does the term evolution mean?
Who gave the first systematic explanation of evolution?
Animals without a backbone are called
Animals with a backbone are called
Which animals live both on land and in water?
What is evolution?
questions.answer: Evolution means gradual and continuous change in living organisms.

questions.question: What happens to animals that cannot adapt?
What are invertebrates?
questions.answer: Animals without a backbone are called invertebrates.

questions.question: Give one example of an invertebrate.
What are vertebrates?
questions.answer: Animals with a backbone are called vertebrates.

questions.question: What are amphibians?
questions.answer: Animals that live both in water and on land are amphibians.

questions.question: Give one example of a reptile.
Why are mammals considered evolved?
questions.answer: They give birth and feed young ones with milk.

questions.question: Which mammals lay eggs?
questions.answer: Platypus and some anteaters lay eggs.

questions.question: What were dinosaurs?
questions.answer: Dinosaurs were large reptiles of ancient times.

questions.question: Why are dinosaurs not seen today?
questions.answer: They became extinct due to natural changes.

questions.question: What are apes?
questions.answer: Apes are animals similar to humans in appearance.

questions.question: Where did the first humans evolve?
questions.answer: The first humans evolved in Africa.

questions.question: Why did some apes evolve into humans?
questions.answer: They adapted to life on land.

questions.question: What is extinction?
questions.answer: Extinction is the complete disappearance of a species.

questions.question: What are fossils?
questions.answer: Fossils are preserved remains of ancient organisms.

questions.question: Why is evolution important?
questions.answer: It explains the development of life on Earth.
